home.subtitle: Your comprehensive guide for the FIRST Championship 2025 in Houston, Texas

attractions.title: Attractions
attractions.subtitle: Discover the best attractions and things to do in Houston during your visit.
attractions.overview: Houston offers a wide variety of attractions for visitors, from world-class museums and cultural institutions to outdoor spaces and entertainment venues. Here are some of the most popular attractions to visit during your stay in Houston.

spaceCenter.name: Space Center & Kemah
spaceCenter.description: Explore NASA's Johnson Space Center and the nearby Kemah Boardwalk for a perfect blend of education and entertainment.

highlights.1: Tour NASA's Johnson Space Center and see real spacecraft
highlights.2: Experience the Kemah Boardwalk with rides, restaurants, and shops
highlights.3: Learn about America's space program and future missions

spaceCenter.gettingThere: Space Center Houston is located about 25 miles southeast of downtown Houston. Kemah Boardwalk is approximately 20 minutes further southeast. Driving is recommended, but guided tours are also available from downtown Houston.

tips.1: Plan at least 4-5 hours for Space Center Houston to see everything
tips.2: Buy Space Center tickets online in advance to avoid lines
tips.3: Visit Kemah Boardwalk in the evening for the best atmosphere
tips.4: Check the Space Center website for special events and astronaut appearances

museumDistrict.name: Museum District
museumDistrict.description: Houston's Museum District features 19 museums within a 1.5-mile radius, offering world-class exhibits in art, science, history, and culture.

highlights.1: Visit the Houston Museum of Natural Science with its dinosaur hall and planetarium
highlights.2: Explore the Museum of Fine Arts with over 65,000 works spanning antiquity to present
highlights.3: Experience the Children's Museum of Houston, rated one of the best in the country
highlights.4: Discover the Health Museum, Holocaust Museum, and Contemporary Arts Museum

museumDistrict.gettingThere: The Museum District is located just south of downtown Houston. It's easily accessible via the METRORail Red Line, with several stations serving the area. Parking is available but can be limited on busy days.

tips.1: Many museums offer free admission on Thursdays
tips.2: Consider the Houston CityPASS if visiting multiple attractions
tips.3: The area is walkable, but the Houston heat can be intense - stay hydrated
tips.4: Some museums require timed entry tickets - check websites before visiting

hermannPark.name: Hermann Park & Zoo
hermannPark.description: Hermann Park is a 445-acre urban park that includes the Houston Zoo, Japanese Garden, Miller Outdoor Theatre, and recreational facilities.

highlights.1: Visit the Houston Zoo with over 6,000 animals from 900 species
highlights.2: Enjoy the Japanese Garden with traditional architecture and landscaping
highlights.3: Ride the Hermann Park Railroad, perfect for families with children
highlights.4: Catch a free performance at Miller Outdoor Theatre (seasonal)

hermannPark.gettingThere: Hermann Park is located adjacent to the Museum District. It's accessible via the METRORail Red Line (Hermann Park/Rice University station). Parking is available in several lots throughout the park.

tips.1: The Houston Zoo is busiest on weekends and holidays - visit on weekdays if possible
tips.2: Bring a picnic to enjoy in designated areas of the park
tips.3: Rent a paddleboat on McGovern Lake for a relaxing experience
tips.4: Check the Miller Outdoor Theatre schedule for free performances

shopping.title: Shopping
shopping.subtitle: Explore shopping options in Houston, from outlet malls to local stores.
shopping.overview: Houston offers a variety of shopping experiences, from large outlet malls to upscale shopping centers and local stores. Here are some recommended shopping destinations for visitors during the FIRST Championship.
shopping.mallsDescription: Houston is home to several large shopping malls and outlet centers. These destinations offer a wide variety of stores, from high-end luxury brands to discounted outlet shops.
shopping.storesDescription: In addition to malls, Houston has several individual stores and shopping districts that offer unique shopping experiences. These include big-box retailers and charming shopping neighborhoods.
shopping.comparisonDescription: This comparison helps you decide where to shop based on your needs and budget. Prices are approximate and may vary.

tips.title: Shopping Tips
tips.tip1: Katy Mills is great for outlet shopping but is farther from downtown (25 miles).
tips.tip2: The Galleria offers high-end shopping and is closer to downtown (8 miles).
tips.tip3: Target and Walmart are best for everyday essentials and basic souvenirs.
tips.tip4: Consider transportation costs when deciding where to shop.
tips.tip5: Many malls offer visitor discount programs - ask at information desks.

1.name: Katy Mills Mall
1.description: A large outlet mall with over 175 stores, including designer brands at discounted prices.

2.name: The Galleria
2.description: Houston's premier shopping destination with over 400 stores, including high-end luxury brands.

3.name: Target
3.description: General merchandise retailer offering a wide variety of products including clothing, electronics, and groceries.

4.name: Walmart Supercenter
4.description: Large retail store offering a wide range of products at affordable prices, including groceries.

5.name: Houston Premium Outlets
5.description: Outdoor outlet mall featuring discounted designer and name-brand stores.

6.name: Rice Village
6.description: Charming shopping district with a mix of national retailers and local boutiques.

firstChampionship.title: FIRST Championship 2025
firstChampionship.subtitle: Everything you need to know about the FIRST Championship event in Houston, April 16-19, 2025.

overview.paragraph1: The FIRST Championship is the culmination of the FIRST Robotics Competition season, bringing together teams from around the world to compete and celebrate STEM education.
overview.paragraph2: The 2025 Championship in Houston will feature competitions across all FIRST programs: FIRST LEGO League Jr., FIRST LEGO League, FIRST Tech Challenge, and FIRST Robotics Competition.

itinerary.title: Complete Travel Plan: April 14-24, 2025
itinerary.description: This itinerary covers the entire trip from departure in Tunis to return, including the FIRST Championship and exploration of Houston's attractions.

spaceCenterKemah.title: Space Center & Kemah Guide
spaceCenterKemah.subtitle: Explore NASA's Johnson Space Center and the Kemah Boardwalk

overview.title: Overview
overview.subtitle: Two of Houston's most popular attractions
overview.description: Space Center Houston and Kemah Boardwalk are two of the most popular attractions in the Houston area, located near each other along the Gulf Coast. Space Center Houston offers an educational experience about NASA and space exploration, while Kemah Boardwalk provides entertainment, dining, and amusement rides on the waterfront. This guide will help you plan your visit to these attractions during the FIRST Championship.

museumDistrict.title: Museum District Guide
museumDistrict.subtitle: Explore Houston's cultural hub
museumDistrict.description: The Houston Museum District is home to 19 museums, galleries, and cultural centers within a 1.5-mile radius of Hermann Park.

hermannPark.title: Hermann Park & Zoo Guide
hermannPark.subtitle: Explore Houston's urban oasis
hermannPark.description: Hermann Park is a 445-acre urban park that includes the Houston Zoo, Japanese Garden, Miller Outdoor Theatre, and recreational facilities. This guide will help you plan your visit during the FIRST Championship.
